subtitle: A very quick dish to make. Good for barbecues or just putting under the grill.

method.text: Preheat oven to 200°C. Arrange tomatoes, cut side up, in a roasting tin with basil leaves and garlic scattered over the top. Season. Drizzle over a little olive oil.
Roast in oven for 25 min. Remove from oven and leave to cool.  Discard herbs then blend tomatoes and garlic until fairly smooth. Pour into a small bowl.

Stretch bacon rashers with a palette knife until double in length. Cut each one in half and roll up. Thread a tomato, mushroom and bacon roll onto wooden skewers, allowing about 4 skewers per serving.
Pour oil into a small pan to a depth of 4 cm. Heat and use to cook kebabs for 1 <sup>1</sup>/<sub>2</sub> - 2 min.
Serve kebabs with the roasted tomato dip.

title: Fondue kebabs with roasted tomato dip
